newsitem.title: USA: Crude link between LOOP and Capline seen reopening.
newsitem.headline: Crude link between LOOP and Capline seen reopening.

text.p: The LOCAP crude pipeline link between the Louisiana Offshore Oil Port (LOOP) and the Capline pipeline system is expected to reopen over the weekend, LOOP officials said on Friday.
A minor leak was discovered in the LOCAP line on Thursday, shutting in some 700,000 barrels per day (bpd) of crude throughput (LOOP officials earlier reported 800,000 bpd was shut in).
LOOP officials said it will not be necessary to declare force majeure and cancel any deliveries.
"By 'over the weekend' they mean 48 hours, so we're looking at opening closer to Sunday than Monday," a LOOP official said.
